items.headline: College sports has a new money problem — and St. John’s may be the latest example: ‘It’s the Wild West’

items.headline: Why portfolio managers are whispering about inflation worries in 2026
items.summary_en: A mix of soaring metals prices, geopolitical risks and threats to the Federal Reserve’s independence is raising the possibility that inflation may push higher than expected in 2026, upsetting traders’ expectations for stable to lower prices.

items.headline: Why Trump’s ‘Great Healthcare Plan’ strikes Wall Street as so underwhelming
items.summary_en: The Trump administration on Thursday rolled out what it’s calling the “Great Healthcare Plan,” with elements that include funding for health savings accounts and a call for Congress to write into law the pricing deals that President Trump has made with drugmakers.
